questions.question: Which ancient ruins site in Peru, known as a symbol of the Incan Empire and often called the 'Lost City of the Incas', was built in the 15th century and is situated 2,430 meters above sea level?
questions.context: Machu Picchu was rediscovered by Hiram Bingham in 1911 and is a marvel of classical Inca-style architecture.

questions.question: What UNESCO World Heritage Site in France was originally constructed in the 12th century and serves as the burial site of the Kings of France?
questions.context: This basilica is widely recognized as the first example of Gothic architecture and is located in the suburb of Paris.

questions.question: Which famous museum, housing an extensive collection of art and historical artifacts, is located in New York and was established in 1870?

answer.label: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York

questions.context: Known as 'The Met', it is one of the largest art museums in the world and has over two million artworks.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel, designed by architect Frank Gehry and completed in 1997, is renowned for its innovative design and is located in the Basque Country of Spain?
questions.context: The museum is acclaimed for its deconstructivist design and has significantly revitalized the city of Bilbao.

questions.question: What famous dark tourism site, located in Austria, served as a concentration camp during World War II and is now a memorial for the victims?
questions.context: Mauthausen was one of the largest labor camps in the Nazi regime and is now a poignant reminder of the Holocaust.
